paper_abstract: An edge covering coloring of a graph G is an edge-coloring of G such that each color appears at each vertex at least one time. The maximum integer k such that G has an edge covering coloring with k colors is called the edge covering chromatic index of G and denoted by chi'(C)(G). It is known that for any graph G with minimum degree delta(G), it holds that delta(G) - 1 <= chi'(c)(G) <= delta(G). Based on the subgraph of G induced by the vertices of minimum degree, we find a new sufficient condition for a graph G to satisfy chi'(c) (G)= delta(G). This result substantially extends a result of Wang et al. in 2006. (C) 2011 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: On edge covering colorings of graphs
